channel.title: Need to change the inventory icon of your custom model? Easy and quick way here!
channel.description:
I made this several months ago to help customize your inventory icon very fast, instead of opening and closing files constantly changing numbers and re-running the client. This generator will give you a preview of your model that you can quickly rotate and save the ints. I am not posting this to try to get my topic more activity or anything, i've been told that it works and is very helpful. So seeing as how it relates directly to custom models and the client i decided to post this.
About the whole 'BETA' thing. The program is completely stable and generates good values. The only reason that it says beta is because i was planning to add more features.
[img]http://img190.imageshack.us/img190/3906/rigrig.png[/img]
For more information: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,381920.0.html

item.title: Need to change the inventory icon of your custom model? Easy and quick way here!
item.dc:creator: @ILOVEJAVA ILOVEJAVA
item.description:
@ILOVEJAVA wrote:

[quote=“licorish55, post:9, topic:322442”]Why?

What do most clients accept up to? (Number of rotations)[/quote]
it’s not the client that accepts numbers, it’s the primitive data type. int is just one type. there is byte, boolean, short, long, char, double, and float. the number range for int, which is what’s being used for this, is -2,147,483,648 at least and 2,147,483,647 at most. (inclusive)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote author=rip4d link=topic=418852.msg3081841#msg3081841 date=1262208605]
Well I just tried and failed, then realized that I was just doing what I originally was but with a .bat file.

@echo off "C:\Program_Files_(x86)\Java\jre6\bin\javaw.exe" C:\Users\Frank\My_Documents\Models\RIG_by_Frell\RIG_1.5b.jar
This should fix that, your way of using it wasnt gonna be effective, your wanting to execute javaw.exe on the Rig, so try this new code.

Read full topic
